case_vignette: A 63-year-old woman comes to the emergency department because of a 1-day history of progressive blurring and darkening of her vision in the right eye. Upon waking up in the morning, she suddenly started seeing multiple dark streaks. She has migraines and type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed at her last health maintenance examination 20 years ago. She has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 40 years. Her only medication is sumatriptan. Her vitals are within normal limits. Ophthalmologic examination shows visual acuity of 20/40 in the left eye and 20/100 in the right eye. The fundus is obscured and difficult to visualize on fundoscopic examination of the right eye. The red reflex is diminished on the right.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have progressive blurring and darkening of my vision in my right eye and I started seeing multiple dark streaks when I woke up this morning.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for 1 day.
Do you have a history of eye trauma or surgery?
No, I do not have a history of eye trauma or surgery.
Do you have any history of diabetes or high blood pressure?
Yes, I was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus 20 years ago.
Have you noticed any flashes of light or a sudden increase in floaters?
No, I have not noticed any flashes of light or a sudden increase in floaters.
Do you experience any pain or redness in the affected eye?
No, I do not experience any pain or redness in the affected eye.
Final Diagnosis: Diabetic retinopathy.
